      • keepLettersOnly

        public static java.lang.String keepLettersOnly(java.lang.CharSequence s)
        Keep letters (A-Z & a-z) only. Remove anything else. Note, this will remove letters like: ä, ñ, ж or λ, too, which, depending on who you ask, are letters too
        Parameters:
        s -
        Returns:

                                               boolean keepSpaces)

      • removeStringDuplicates

        public static java.lang.String removeStringDuplicates(@NonNull
                                                      java.lang.String strToFix)
        Remove String duplicates. IE, "I want to go go home" --> "I want to go home". Note that this will replace strings in unintentional ways! IE: "I want to go to the home" --> "I want to go the home".
        Parameters:
        strToFix - String to fix
        Returns:
        Fixed / changed String. IF Null or empty, will return original

      • doesEqual

        public static boolean doesEqual(java.lang.String str1,
                                int posStart,
                                int posEnd,
                                java.lang.String str2)
        Shortcut to check for equals where the strings passed may or may not be null
        Parameters:
        str1 - String 1 to compare
        posStart - int start position to check the strings for comparison
        posEnd - int end position to check the Strings for comparison
        str2 - String 2 to compare. This is the one that will be substringed for comparison
        Returns:
        True if they are equal

      • doesStringContain

        public static boolean doesStringContain(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String originalString,
                                        int posStart,
                                        int posEnd,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.lang.String otherStringToCheckFor)
        Simple checker whether the first string contains the second string within a certain position within the String
        Parameters:
        originalString - String to check: IE, Patrick
        posStart - POS to start: IE, 0
        posEnd - POS to end: IE, 4
        otherStringToCheckFor - String: IE, Pat
        Returns:
        true if it does contain it within those bounds, else false. If wanting to check equality of those strings, see doesEqual(String, int, int, String)

      • replaceStringIgnoreCase

        public static java.lang.String replaceStringIgnoreCase(@NonNull
                                                       java.lang.String originalString,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       java.lang.String toRemove,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       java.lang.String toReplace)
        Replace a String using the str to replace (Will accept regex). This is ignore case so passing in different case Strings will replace successfully
        Parameters:
        originalString - Original String (IE, June 20)
        toRemove - To remove (IE, june)
        toReplace - To Replace (IE, june)
        Returns:
        Altered String (IE june 20) or original String if null or empty

                                             java.lang.String originalString,

                                             java.lang.String toRemove,
                                             @NonNull
                                             java.lang.String toReplace)
        Replace a String using the literal (no regex) str to replace
        Parameters:
        originalString - Original String (IE, June 20)
        toRemove - To remove (IE, 20)
        toReplace - To Replace (IE, 21)
        Returns:
        Altered String (IE June 21) or original String if null or empty

      • toTitleCase

        public static java.lang.String toTitleCase(java.lang.String str)

        Parameters:
        str - String to convert
        Returns:
        Converted String. If null or empty passed, passes back same

      • convertNameToPhoneNumber

        public static java.lang.String convertNameToPhoneNumber(java.lang.String str)
        Takes in a String and converts it to a number matching a phone number type. Example would be you send int "ABC", it will return "222" as on a phone dial screen, ABC are all on the 2 key.
        Parameters:
        str - String to parse
        Returns:
        String of numbers to match converted number

      • convertNumberToStringList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertNumberToStringList(java.lang.String str,
                                                                         boolean includeBothCases)
        Takes in a String and converts it to a string list matching a query using a phone keypad. An example would be, send in 728 and it would return a list containing: {"PQRS", "ABC", "TUV"}
        Parameters:
        str - String to parse into an integer. If it fails int parsing, returns null
        includeBothCases - Boolean, if true, it will add both upper and lower cases to string list. IE, 728 would return: {"PpQqRrSs","AaBbCc","TtUuVv"}
        Returns:
        List of Strings to match converted number

      • convertStringToBoolean

        public static java.lang.Boolean convertStringToBoolean(java.lang.String str)
        Checks a String to see if it can be easilly converted to a boolean. If it can be, it will be returned as true or false, else, it will return null.
        Parameters:
        str - String to check
        Returns:
        Boolean, true or false, null if it cannot be parsed

        public static java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(android.content.Context context,
                                               android.net.Uri uri)

        Parameters:

        uri - Uri to check
        Returns:
        String for the absolute path

      • fixFileUri

        public static android.net.Uri fixFileUri(android.content.Context context,
                                         android.net.Uri selectedImageUri)
        Use this method to fix URIs that are not usable or are in a format not readable. An example would be one that starts with content://.......... This tries to make a file and when it succeeds, it means that the URI was correct. The main purpose of this method is to handle how some phone makers handle this differently (IE Motorola vs HTC vs Samsung)
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        selectedImageUri - The Uri to work with
        Returns:

      • fixAndBuildFileUri

        public static java.io.File fixAndBuildFileUri(android.content.Context context,
                                              android.net.Uri selectedImageUri)
        Use this method to fix URIs that are not usable or are in a format not readable. An example would be one that starts with content://.......... This tries to make a file and when it succeeds, it means that the URI was correct. The main purpose of this method is to handle how some phone makers handle this differently (IE Motorola vs HTC vs Samsung)
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        selectedImageUri - The Uri to work with
        Returns:

      • buildAStringFromUnknowns

        public static java.lang.String buildAStringFromUnknowns(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                        java.lang.String delimiter)
        Builds a String via the passed String array. If the individual String is null or empty, it skips it. If the delimiter is empty, skips that too
        Parameters:
        args - String array to use
        delimiter - Delimiter to use (IE , or a space or _ or / or | )
        Returns:
        Fully completed and written String. Example: String str = buildAStringFromUnknowns(new String[]{"2016", "07", "04"}, "/"); str would print as: "2016/07/04"

        public static java.lang.String convertInputStreamToString(java.io.InputStream is)
        Convert an input stream to a STring
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream to convert
        Returns:

      • anyNullsInStrings

        public static boolean anyNullsInStrings(java.lang.String[] args)
        Checks if any of the Strings passed via an array are null
        Parameters:
        args - String array to check
        Returns:
        boolean, true if any are null

      • anyNullsOrEmptyInStrings

        public static boolean anyNullsOrEmptyInStrings(java.lang.String[] args)
        Checks if any of the Strings passed via an array are null or are empty ("");
        Parameters:
        args - String array to check
        Returns:
        boolean, true of any are null or are empty

      • getPath

        public static java.lang.String getPath(android.content.Context context,
                                       android.net.Uri uri)
        From - http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19985286/convert-content-uri-to-actual-path-in-android-4-4 Get a file path from a Uri. This will get the the path for Storage Access Framework Documents, as well as the _data field for the MediaStore and OTHER file-based ContentProviders.
        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        uri - The Uri to query.

      • getDataColumn

        public static java.lang.String getDataColumn(android.content.Context context,
                                             android.net.Uri uri,
                                             java.lang.String selection,
                                             java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Get the value of the data column for this Uri. This is useful for MediaStore Uris, and OTHER file-based ContentProviders.
        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        uri - The Uri to query.
        selection - (Optional) Filter used in the query.
        selectionArgs - (Optional) Selection arguments used in the query.
        Returns:
        The value of the _data column, which is typically a file path.

      • isCurseWord

        public static boolean isCurseWord(android.content.Context context,
                                  java.lang.String str,
                                  java.lang.String[] curseWords)
        Checks for curse words in the String
        Parameters:
        str - String to compare against.
        Returns:
        True if it matches a curse word, false it it does not. NOTE! This will not check for contains, only equals. The reason for this is because if you have something like the word "assistant" the first 3 letters will trigger this to return true.

      • getSizeOfBase64String

        public static double getSizeOfBase64String(@NonNull
                                           java.lang.String base64String)
        Determine the size (in bytes) of the base64 String. From: http://www.siddharthpandey.net/how-to-calculate-the-size-of-a-base64-encoded-string/
        Parameters:
        base64String -
        Returns:
        Returns size in long. If null or unable to determine, returns -1

        Returns:

      • convertDatesToSMSTimeMeasurements

        public static java.lang.String convertDatesToSMSTimeMeasurements(java.util.Date timeEventHappened,
                                                                 java.util.Date currentTime)
        For converting 2 times into SMS-like format where it shows "how long ago" someone did something. IE, when someone sends you a message 'just now' vs 'an hour ago'
        Parameters:
        timeEventHappened - Time the event happened
        currentTime - current time (if null, it will just get current time)
        Returns:
        String of the converted date. If something fails, it will return the time the event happened to string (date.toString())
